We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Trainee Engineer
Job Location:&nbsp;Mushin, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking an enthusiastic Trainee Engineer to support on-site construction activities across building projects.
	Reporting to the Senior/Site Manager, you will assist with day-to-day supervision, quality checks, basic layout and measurements, and maintaining accurate site records while learning practical site engineering skills.


Responsibilities


	Assist with daily on-site supervision to ensure work follows approved drawings, specifications and schedules.
	Read and apply architectural and structural drawings for on-site execution.
	Carry out setting-out, measurements and basic surveying tasks under supervision.
	Support routine quality checks and inspections (concrete, reinforcement, finishes) and raise non-conformance reports.
	Maintain accurate site records: daily reports, material logs, progress photos and attendance sheets.
	Monitor material usage on site and liaise with procurement/logistics to report shortfalls or delays.
	Help coordinate contractors, subcontractors and site staff to keep workflow smooth.
	Report site issues promptly and support senior staff to implement corrective actions.
	Enforce safety procedures and environmental guidelines on site.
	Attend site meetings and prepare clear progress updates for the project team.


Requirement


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Civil Engineering or closely related discipline.
	0 &ndash; 2 years of practical experience.
	Ability to read and interpret structural and architectural drawings.
	Basic competence with AutoCAD and Microsoft Office (Excel/Word); willingness to learn project management tools.
	Good numeracy, attention to detail and practical problem-solving skills.
	Strong communication and teamwork skills; ability to take direction and learn on the job.
	Knowledge of basic construction methods, materials and health &amp; safety practices.


Salary
N80,000 - N100,000 / month

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;infowatolexcis@gmail.com&nbsp;using &quot;Trainee Engineer&quot; as the subject of the email.",

Job Position: Legal / HR Associate

Job Location:&nbsp;Ogudu, Lagos

	This role is responsible for providing HR, administrative and legal support to ensure the efficient operation of the HR, legal and administrative functions of the organization.


Responsibilities


	Draft, review, and negotiate various MOUs, Contracts, non disclosures and tender documents.
	Handle statutory filings, and regulatory submissions and liaise with the Accounts department on tax compliance requirements.

	Stay abreast with changes to legislation (laws &amp; regulations) that directly affect our businesses and specific industry, interpret, evaluate their impact.
	Identify, manage and mitigate legal risks by presenting clear recommendations and developing and implementing company policies and procedures.
	Providing legal advice and guidance on a wide array of matters including privacy, medical staff issues, HR policies, procedures, and compliance.
	Oversee internal investigations related to HR issues and manage and resolve employment issues and disputes.
	Ensure compliance with local, state, and federal labor laws and regulations.
	Develop and implement HR-related legal strategies and initiatives.

Chief Accountant Job at Polo - Cico Farms and Estate Limited




        
    

        
        Polo - Cico Farms and Estate is adiversified farm complex specializing in large-scale greenhouse production of assorted pepper varieties, alongside poultry and catfish farming for local and international markets.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chief Accountant
Job Location: Omoku, Rivers

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Set up an accounting system for the farm for gathering and analyzing financial information generated from all farm operations to provide accurate reports to the managing director.
	Ensures the reconciliation of all bank accounts monthly and follow up on any reconciliation item.
	Prepare annual financial statements and monthly closing and management accounting reports and schedules.
	Assists the managing director in budget planning, as well as controlling and forecasting income and expenditure.
	Ensures that accurate financial information to the Managing Director for presentation to board of directors are timely available.
	Assists in providing support during interim and final audits of the account of the company by external Auditors through provision of relevant documents and information.
	Ensures that company’s assets are managed effectively with accurate and complete records duly kept.
	Ensures statutory returns are accurately made to relevant tax authorities including PAYE, Pensions etc.
	Ensures strict adherence to Finance standard operating procedure in all the activities of the department.
	Review payroll and ensure the monthly salary schedule and the required statutory taxes, NSITF and pension deductions are promptly remitted to respective statutory bodies.
	Manage stocks and all stocks related issues.


Requirements


	HND / B.Sc in Accountancy / Finance and must be a Chattered Accountant with at least 3 years of experience as head of Accounts/Finance.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV to: aghoghoac@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
